sections.title: Section D. OPD Health Care Workers Observations

subSections.title: Health Provider Information

inputRows.label: What is the cadre of the observed health provider?
Has this health provider received formal training in malaria case management

subSections.instruction: Instructions: Observe the health service provider while attending to a client with fever. The health service provider should not be interrupted unless the patient is severely ill or if the practice of the clinician will put the patient in danger. Note, if there are more than one clinician at OPD then observations should be done on different clinicians. If there is only one clinician available, then make all two observations on him/her.

subSections.title: D.1 General Clinical History

inputRows.label: Whether the patient is pregnant? (mark NA if the patient is male or a child)
Current fever or fever in last 24 hours?
If diarrhoea present, did clinician ask if diarrhoea was bloody?
If cough present, did clinician ask about duration of cough?
Did the clinician ask about other symptoms (discharge from ear, rash, headache, painful urination)?
Was treatment given before coming to this health facility (either at home or another health facility)?
If yes, did the health worker ask about the type of treatment?
Similar illness in the last few weeks?
General Clinical History observation sub score

subSections.title: D.5 (c) Treatment - With reference to IMCI guidelines, continue the following section if the patient is a child under five years of age diagnosed to have acute watery diarrhoea (AWD) or pneumonia.

Was the child treated under plan A, B or C for rehydration?

Did the clinician make correct diagnosis basing on severity of illness of the child?
Did the clinician make provide correct treatment for diagnosis made?

subSections.instruction: Instructions: Observe the health service provider while attending to a client with fever. The health service provider should not be interrupted unless the patient is severely ill or if the practice of the clinician will put the patient in danger. Note, if there are more than on clinicians at OPD then observations should be done on different clinicians. If there is only one clinician available, then make all two observations on him/her. If there is no client during facility visit or clients do not suffer from Acute Watery Diarrhea or pneumonia, simulation should be done.

sections.title: Section E. Pre-Referral Management of Severe Malaria

inputRows.label: Preparation & Administration of Injectable Artesunate for Severe Malaria
Step 1: Gets the contents correctly out of the package (check for the availability of the following three items: sodium bicarbonate ampoule, Artesunate vials and 5% Dextrose/0.9 saline ampoule)
Step 2: Draws 1ml of sodium bicarbonate into the syringe
Step 3: Adds 1ml of sodium bicarbonate into Artesunate vials (60mg)
Step 5: Waits until completely dissolve and solution is clear
Step 6: Draws into syringe 5% Dextrose/0.9 saline (2ml for IM; 5ml for IV)
Step 7: Adds the contents into Artesunate vial
Step 9: Determines the dose (round up to the nearest ml)
Step 10: Draws the required dose into the syringe
Step 11: Discarded al the syringes and needles into safety box immediately after use
Absence of any diluted Artesunate not used within one hour from reconstitution in the injection area

sections.instruction:
Instructions: Observe a staff person who regularly treats severe malaria patients while they prepare and administer injectable Artesunate – either through demonstration or observation of an actual patient interaction. Do not interrupt unless the patient is critically ill and needs immediate intervention/attention or if the practice of the clinician will put the patient in danger. If you are not able to observe, please fill out the reason at the end of this observation and complete the knowledge section below.
Note: Pre referral/pre admission management to be provided and assessed at emergency medicine department or OPD for referral hospitals

sections.title: Section F. Exit Interview - Client Satisfaction

inputRows.label: Were you able to get a client for interview?
Was the length of time taken to wait in order to be seen by the health care provider reasonable?
Did the health care provider ask/tell what is wrong with you or your child?
Were you confident with the health care provider who was treating / advising you or your child? (probe)
Did the health care provider give you the instructions on how to use the medicines in a way that you could understand?
Were you educated about malaria prevention and control?

sections.instruction: Instructions: Conduct exit interview to two clients who have just received services at OPD before they leave a facility to assess client satisfaction.

sections.instruction: Instruction: Select three patients who were suspected to have malaria from the OPD register for the last six months. Follow these patients in daily dispensing register, National Malaria Case Register and laboratory register using their names and dates. Fill the information in the table
